data.title: Canine Companions
data.meta_description: Lead with independence. Canine Companions is leading the service dog industry so people with disabilities can live with greater independence.
data.text:
CHECK US OUT ON NETFLIX!

Discover the scientific and emotional insights about our lovable dogs.

VOLUNTEER WITH US!

Learn how you can help change lives of people with disabilities.

SPONSOR A PUPPY

Support Myrtle and Milton's journey from puppy to service dog!

PREORDER TODAY!

Be one of the first to receive a calendar full of puppy adorableness!

EVENTS & GALAS

Celebrate and meet new volunteers in your community.

Receive our newsletters

Comments

How You Can Help

Donate

You can make a monthly or a one-time gift and help provide highly trained service dogs to people with disabilities FREE of charge.

Start a Fundraiser

Do you want to dedicate your wedding, birthday or other event to Canine Companions? Click the button below to start a DIY fundraiser.

Volunteer

Join our national community of volunteers working to support our mission through puppy raising, events, on-campus help and more.

Planned Giving

Would you like to include Canine Companions in your estate plans or trust? Find out more about these options and other ways you can support our mission.

In the News

Canine Companions Celebrates the Placement of Its 8,000th Service Dog Team

Canine Companions Graduation Ceremony on August 9th will mark an exciting milestone for Canine Companions. During the graduation, where clients are paired with their service dogs, they’ll place their 8,000th service dog team.

Click here to read more about this article

Canine Companions Featured in Netflix’s ‘Inside the Mind of a Dog’

Uncover what your dog is thinking in “Inside the Mind of a Dog,” on Netflix Aug 9. Voiced by Rob Lowe, this film explores canine cognition, training, and the human-dog bond.

Click here to read more about this article

Welcome Cathy Rodgers – Southeast Region’s New Executive Director

Canine Companions welcomes Cathy Rodgers as the new executive director of the Southeast Region training center.

Click here to read more about this article
